sen.j: 古民家（こみんか）とは、民家のうちでも特に建造されてから、時を経たものをいう。
sen.e: Kominka refers to the traditional Japanese house, especially the ones built long time ago.
The term kominka refers to traditional Japanese houses, especially ones built a long time ago.
The term kominka refers to traditional Japanese houses, especially ones built a long time ago.

sen.j: 古民家の定義に、どの時代に建てられたものか、あるいは建造され何年を経たものを指すかの定義はないが、通常戦前以前のもの、特に大正以前のものをさす場合が多い。
sen.e: There is no definition for kominkas such as what period they were built or how many years have been passed since they were built, but usually, they often refers to the ones built before the war, especially before the Taisho period.

Kominka are not defined by the period they were built or how old they are, but usually the term is used when referring to houses built before the Second World War, and especially to those built before the Taisho Period.

Kominka are not defined by the period they were built or how old they are, but usually the term is used when referring to houses built before the World War II, and especially to those built before the Taisho Period.

sen.j: また、その建築方式が釘などを使わない伝統的日本建築で建てられた建物を特定することが多い。
sen.e: Also, in many cases, they specifically refer to the buildings built by the method of traditional Japanese construction in which nails and so on are not used.
Also, in many cases, the term specifically refers to buildings built using traditional Japanese methods of construction in which such elements as nails are not used.
Also, in many cases, the term specifically refers to buildings built using traditional Japanese methods of construction in which such elements as nails are not used.

sen.j: 最近の日本では、こうした木造軸組構法の合理性、耐久性が見直されつつあり、取り壊される寸前の古民家を再生する試みなども多く行われている。
sen.e: Recently in Japan, the rationality and durability of these traditional Japanese construction methods using wood for materials are being revised and they frequently attempt to revive the kominka which is on the verge of demolition.

Recently in Japan the rationality and durability of these traditional Japanese construction methods using wood as the main material are being looked at again and there have been an increasing number of attempts to preserve kominka on the verge of demolition.
sen.cmt: Word choice, grammar, changed for clarity.
sen.e: Recently in Japan the rationality and durability of these traditional Japanese construction methods using wood as the main material are being looked at again and there have been an increasing number of attempts to preserve kominka on the verge of demolition.

sen.j: 背景には、伝統的町並みの喪失、環境問題、日本人のアイデンティティーなどの問題意識が、最近になって日本人にようやく芽生えてきたことがある。
sen.e: Behind these, only recently among Japanese, the problem consciousness such as the lost of traditional cityscape, environmental problem and Japanese identity and so on has arisen eventually.

Reasons for this include an increased consciousness in recent times on the part of many Japanese in relation to the loss of traditional architecture, environmental problems and issues surrounding Japanese identity.

Reasons for this include an increased consciousness in recent times on the part of many Japanese in relation to the loss of traditional typical buildings and houses along the streets, environmental problems and issues surrounding Japanese identity.
sen.cmt: 「町並み」の訳語を変えました (architecture→typical buildings and houses along the streets)

sen.j: 古民家には、その使用目的や時代、地域、気候など諸条件によって多くの建築様式があり、使用目的に限っても農家、庄屋屋敷、一般民家（都市部の民家）、商家、武家民家、建家屋敷などがある。
sen.e: Among kominkas there are many styles of architecture by several conditions such as the purpose of use, period, region, climate and so on, and in the limited case of the purpose of use, there are farm houses, houses of village headmen, ordinary houses (houses in urban area), mercantile houses, houses of samurai family and so on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 「建家屋敷」なるものが一体、普通の「屋敷」とどう違うのか判明しませんでしたので、訳出しておりません。
sen.e: There are many styles of kominka architecture depending on the purpose, period, region, climate and other factors, and there is considerable variety just within their function, being used as farm houses, the residences of village headmen, ordinary urban houses, mercantile houses, residences of samurai families and so on.

There are many styles of kominka architecture depending on the purpose, period, region, climate and other factors, and there is considerable variety just within their function, being used as farm houses, the residences of village headmen, ordinary urban houses, mercantile houses, residences of samurai families and so on.

sen.j: 岩手県を中心に東北地方周辺にみられる曲屋、白川郷などに見られる多層階建ての合掌造りなどの特殊な民家も見られる。
sen.e: Around the Tohoku region centering on Iwate prefecture, we can see particular kinds of Japanese traditional houses such as multistoried "gassho-zukuri" (a house built of wooden beams combined to form a steep thatched roof that resembles two hands together) in Magariya, Shirakawago and so on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In the Magariya found across the Tohoku region centering on Iwate prefecture, and in the multistoried "gassho-zukuri" (a house built of wooden beams combined to form a steep thatched roof that resembles two hands together) in Shirakawago we can see specific and unique kinds of Japanese traditional house.

In the Magariya (a L-shaped house having a staple block) found across the Tohoku region centering on Iwate prefecture, and in the multistoried "gassho-zukuri" (a house built of wooden beams combined to form a steep thatched roof that resembles two hands together) in Shirakawago we can see specific and unique kinds of Japanese traditional house.
sen.cmt: (L-shaped house having a staple block)を追加。なお訳者は曲屋を地名と考えていた模様。

sen.j: 屋根は、本来は主に茅葺が多いが、草葺などもある。
sen.e: Most of the roofs are originally thatched, but some are grass-thatched.
Most of the roofs were originally thatched, but some were specifically thatched with grass.
Most of the roofs were originally thatched, but some were specifically thatched with grass.

sen.j: 最近はその上にトタンを貼ったものや、葺き替えて作られた、瓦葺、瓦棒葺、トタン葺などが多くなった。
sen.e: Nowadays, the ones with zinc roof over the thatched roof, the ones which are tile-roofed, ribbed-seam roofed or zinc roofed and so on have increased.
In recent years, there has been an increase in kominka with a zinc roof over the thatched roof, ones roofed with tiles, ribbed-seam roofed houses and those with an entirely zinc roof.
sen.cmt: Grammar, word choice, changed for clarity.
sen.e: In recent years, there has been an increase in kominka with a zinc roof over the thatched roof, ones roofed with tiles, ribbed-seam roofed houses and those with an entirely zinc roof.

sen.j: しかしながら、老朽化や住人の高齢化に伴い取り壊される建築が多くなっている。
sen.e: However, many of them have been destroyed because they are old or the residents are aging.
However, many of those that have become delapidated or with elderly owners who can no longer maintain them have been destroyed.
However, many of those that have become dilapidated or with elderly owners who can no longer maintain them have been destroyed.

sen.j: 古民家に使われている木材は、現在のハウスメーカーに代表される安易な方法とは異なり、いわゆる適材適所が採用されている。
sen.e: Concerning the timbers used in kominka, the right ones are put in the right places, which is different from the all-too-easy method of typical present-day housing manufacturers.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In contrast to the simple and easy methods used by typical present-day construction companies, the timbers used in building kominka have specific types used in specific parts of the construction.
In contrast to the simple and easy methods used by typical present-day construction companies, the timbers used in building kominka have specific types used in specific parts of the construction.

sen.j: 腐りやすい部分には欅、栗、桧などが使用され、梁 (建築)には強度の高い松、内装には杉などの目に優しく木目の美しい木材や、調湿効果に優れた素材が使い分けられる。
sen.e: For the perishable parts, zelkova tree, chestnut tree and Japanese cypress tree are used, and for the joists, strong pine tree, and for the interior materials, the timbers which have simply and beautifully grained or the ones which have a good humidity conditioning, accordingly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: For the perishable parts, zelkova, chestnut and Japanese cypress are used, for the joists strong varieties of pine, and for the interior sections timbers which have simple and beautiful grain or ones which are not affected by high humidity.

For the perishable parts, zelkova, chestnut and Japanese cypress are used, for the joists strong varieties of pine, and for the interior sections timbers which have simple and beautiful grain or ones which are not affected by high humidity.

sen.j: このため、メンテナンスさえ怠らなければ、200年から300年は持つように作られている。
sen.e: For this reason, if not fail to do maintenance, it was built to keep for 200 to 300 years.
For this reason, as long as they are reasonably maintained kominka were built to last for 200 to 300 years.

sen.e: For this reason, as long as they are reasonably maintained kominka were built to last for 200 to 300 years.

sen.j: また、囲炉裏の煙でじっくり燻された木材は、時を経るごとに味のある色に変化していき、その経年変化と、部屋の奥に入るにしたがって、外光が減衰してゆく光の演出こそが、谷崎潤一郎が「陰影礼賛」に記したように、日本人の美学に馴染むものであった。
sen.e: Also, the timber thoroughly smoked by irori fireplace (open hearth) changes to nuanced color and varies across the ages as time goes by, and the rendering by light where outside light are weakened as going into the room is very familiar with aesthetic of Japanese as in "Inei Raisan (In Praise of Shadows)" by Junichiro TANIZAKI.
sen.cmt: 「馴染むものであった」と過去形ですが、日本語の時制の曖昧さゆえと判断し、訳文では現在形としました。
sen.e: Also, the timbers are thoroughly weathered by the smoke from the irori fireplace (open hearth) and their colour changes and becomes enriched as time goes by, and the effect of the light where the light from outside becomes weakened when entering the room is a familiar aesthetic of Japanese culture, as typified in the work "Inei Raisan (In Praise of Shadows)" by Junichiro TANIZAKI.
